intro: Brachtia sulphurea, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Brachtia sulphurea is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
